Obsidian is a volcanic glass, a comparatively rare and crystal-poor form of rhyolite, the most silica-rich lava. It forms when lava is quenches, or rapidly cooled. Obsidian is a major component of Glass Mountain. Provided by Jeff Dinnel, Tionesta, California
